results.title: Three American ballads
results.creator_credit: University of California. Dept. of Theatre Arts. Motion Picture Division
results.brief_description: A series of humorous sketches and semi-abstract drawings are used to interpret three American ballads - “Acres of Clams”, “Old Dan Tucker” and “John Henry”. The artist, Alfred Kousel, has provided innumerable still sketches which combine colour, a feeling of strength and a variety of emotional effects in harmony with the moods and rhythms of the ballads. The ballads are sung by Cisco Houston.

results.title: This man
results.creator_credit: Keith Laxton, J.N. Bagnall and Australian Board of Missions
results.brief_description: This film is about the impact of Western culture on the people of the Pacific. It tells of the Melanesian’s loss of a sense of identity and meaning, and the disappearance of the old ways that gave happiness and security. It is often angry and bitter, but is not without hope, for the man of Melanesia is determined to find the way out of his confusion and despair. Based on a Melanesian play by Francis Bugotu and Tony Hughes.

results.title: This is not Beirut
results.brief_description: Experimental in its format, “This is not Beirut” is a wonderful documentary comprising of an eclectic mix of film footage from Hi-8, VHS and “found” film material shot and collected in Lebanon during 1992. Filmmaker Jayce Salloum took on the challenge of selecting from over 200 hours of film footage to produce a unique and intriguing piece of film journalism which focuses mainly on Beirut, a city sometimes called the “City of eternity”, “Jewel of the Levant”, or “Window on the West” or conversely the “City in crisis”, “City of fear”, or “Improbable city”. By putting together a montage of these images Salloum provides an insight into Beirut and Lebanon, the constant reconstruction, structually and mentally, from years of bombings, kidnappings, killings, internal warfare, terrorists, resistance movements, and Israeli aggression and invasion. Enhancing this constantly changing stream of images is a soundtrack of interviews, conversations and commentary, television and radio broadcasts, street noises, music and even the occasional silent piece of footage. Salloum attempts to represent Lebanon and the Lebanese people as they see themselves and not necessarily as the West sees them, a concept which proves to be more difficult and problematical than expected. Historically interesting and a most enlightening documentary.

results.title: This Bloomin' world
results.brief_description: A study of the colour and form of a flower, contrasting the beauty of a flower with the insensitivity to nature by humans. Aims to increase awareness by showing communities which have used flowers to improve their environment. Uses microphotography and music.

results.title: This'll do me
results.brief_description: Scenes showing the manufacture and use of fibrous plaster products are used to illustrate the various opportunities for employment in the fibrous plaster industry. Shows the manufacture of plaster sheet and cornice moulds and also the making by hand of moulds for commemorative plaques, complicated patterns used in interior design, window display modellings and other materials requiring the work of skilled artists.

results.title: Thirsty land
results.creator_credit: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan and World Food Program
results.brief_description: Describes the search for water in the deserts of Jordan, and other UN assisted works - the training of the Bedouin in farming techniques, the reclamation of land, irrigation, improvement of communications and reafforestation.

results.title: Thermionic valve
results.brief_description: The thermionic valve makes possible the control of energy that is released when electricity is liberated from a metal. The thermionic valve is the radio valve - the forerunner to mini valves, thence the transistor.

results.title: There once lived a dog
results.creator_credit: E. Nazarov and Soviet Film Studios Moscow
results.brief_description: A delightful Ukrainian folk tale about a pet dog who becomes a nuisance and is dumped in the local woods. The dog, with the help of a wolf, plans a way to be reaccepted by his owners.
